Originally written by guydehade
Edited by Mr-Lac

Bowser laid back with a groan on his throne, scheming away at another greater plan to win over the Mushroom Kingdom and its lovely ruler. Head resting in his clawed hand, he grumbled as he remembered the two reasons his plans always seem to fail, the red annoying plumber fouling up his works and his green stache brother.

Mario and Luigi.

"Those pesky plumbers!", he snarled. "They make me... AARRRGGHHH!" Fire escaping out from his mouth, causing some of his underlings to get nervous and frightened while standing nearby from with great frustration.

"Every time I try to grab Peach, they get in my way! What do they even get for it? Cake? Pecks on the cheek? She's got that sort of refined charm going on, but... Argh! If only there was some way to get them to stop being so... Persistent..."

While the Koopa King continued to mull thoughts over in his head, Kammy, his high-ranking member of the Koopa Troop and right-hand woman, entered the throne room while floating in with her broomstick; crackling away at something...

"What's got you into a laughing fit?" Bowser asked, his thoughts interrupted by Kammy's sudden laughing appearance.

"I think I have the perfect solution!" Kammy replied back slyly.

"Perfect solution to what?"

"To what you've been blabbering about for the last hour, honestly, the entire castle could hear your groans of despair!" She snapped. "I'll make the princess so grotesque to those plumbers, they'll be RELIEVED when you show up to take her away!"

"Really? You think that would work?" Bowser said, intrigued by this crazy idea. "I've always thought she'd be cuter if she was a bit heavier anyway, and loosened up some... But... "

Scratching his chin with her clawed fingers, "How do you suppose we do that...?"

"Nyeah heh heh heh! We have to be sneaky about it. Can't have them figuring we're behind it, or they'll try fixing her first... How should I go about this...?"

Princess Peach was taking a walk around her castle's courtyard. Between constantly getting captured and participating in go-kart races and golf tournaments, she rarely had any time to herself, so she made sure to savor every moment. As she took in the beautiful sunlight, she suddenly saw something strange on the ground. It looked like one of the many mushrooms that grew in the Kingdom, except it appeared to have chubby cheeks, sleepy-looking eyes, a yellow cap with brown spots, and it gave off a strange odor.

"Wow, I've never seen this kind of mushroom before." Peach said. "Maybe I should tell someone..."

She was about to get up and do so, but for some reason, the mushroom's odor seemed to be calling her back. It was not a terrible smell, but there seemed to be something very addicting about it. She leaned down closer to the mushroom and then picked it up, taking in a big whiff of it.

"Hmm, not bad." Peach said. "Not great, but not bad..."

Suddenly, out of sheer curiosity, Peach took a small bite out of the mushroom, finding it to be one of the most wonderful tastes ever! She then gobbled up the rest of the mushroom and rubbed her full belly in satisfaction.

"Well, that mushroom was very filling." Peach said. "I should look up what kind of mushroom that was..."

But suddenly, just as she was about to go to a Library to look it up...

Blinking awake, Zelda looked at her surroundings through fuzzy eyes. She was in a concrete grey room with no windows and a single, metal door directly in front of her. Definitely not the room she had fallen asleep in...

"Link? Are you out there?" Zelda called out nervously. Link was normally within earshot, but this time, he didn't come running. If she wasn't nervous before about being in a completely unfamiliar room, she definitely was now.
Closing her eyes, Zelda tried to recall what had happened...

She had decided to visit Kakariko Village. She wanted to ask Impa about the Yiga Clan and the threat they still posed. For some reason, when she mentioned this idea to Link, his face went bright red and he had turned away, mumbling something about paya seeds. However, as soon as Zelda had grabbed the reins of her horse, he was back to his usual stoic face. He had followed her silently to Kakariko, only faltering when Zelda had thrown open the doors to Impa's building. He had them mumbled something about checking on the horses and then disappeared.

As Zelda strode in, a girl with grey hair bowed low. She looked expectantly at the door, but for some reason, her expectancy turned to disappointment, and she went back to scrubbing the wooden floor.
"Please don't mind Paya," A wizened woman with a wide-brimmed hat said. "She was looking for-"
"Grandmother!" Paya wailed, sitting up. "She doesn't need to know that!"

Impa chuckled.
"Very well, dear. Princess Zelda, it is always nice to see you. To what do I owe the pleasure of your visit?"
Sitting on her knees in front of Impa, exactly the way she had been taught years ago, Zelda had asked about the current status of the Yiga Clan. Impa's eyes had fallen sadly as she explained the current situation with the Sheikah Outcasts, how they were still at large and even more dangerous after Ganon had fallen.

Despite the solemn topic, the pair had talked until the sun was hanging low in the sky. Satisfied with the answers she had recieved, Zelda had left Impa's house and headed for the shrine overlooking the village. Having spent months upon months researching them, Zelda found an odd level of comfort sitting around them. Upon reaching it, she sat on the cold stone surface that acted at the teleport pad for the Sheikah Slate and lay back. Despite daylight still being present in the slowly darkening sky, she felt her eyelids slowly drooping...

And that was all she remembered. She didn't know of any concrete rooms within Kakariko, the Sheikah choosing to build with wood. In fact, she hadn't seen many concrete structures during her travels through Hyrule...

"Well, well... Princess Zelda..."
Zelda's eyes jerked open. She hadn't noticed the metal door silently open, an amazing feet for something so heavy. Standing in the doorway was a woman clad in red and black robes. A pendant depicting an upside down eye hung around her neck, staring at Zelda...

Realization hit her.

"You're the Yiga Clan!" She accused.
"Guilty as charged, Princess. But anyway, that's beside the point," She laughed. "The point is you, and how you so rudely killed our dear god. You made our new master so indescribably mad, his only order is to get him that 'Damn Princess', as he so kindly put it. And now that he has you, it's my turn. His plan for you was made clear to me. Of course, you'll learn all about it soon enough..."

The woman giggled.
"Now, to work. First, we'll do this!"
Producing a dirty rag, she strode over to Zelda and tied it around her eyes. With her vision gone, the nervous princess relied on her hearing. But all she could hear was the woman muttering and circling her bound body. Straining her ears, she picked up faint words. Something about her body...

"And... Done!" The woman giggled again. "Chances are I won't see you again. But if I do..."
She didn't finish. She switched over to another faint chant, and within a couple of words, she felt her eyes drowsily closing...

"What?!"
Zelda sat bolt upright. She was lying on a glowing blue platform, overlooking the village of Kakariko. The sun was just coming up, chasing the shadows out of the dark village. She had slept all night..?

"Was it just a dream?" Zelda mumbled to herself, rubbing the sleep out of her eyes. "It couldn't have been..."
As Zelda got to her feet...

It didn't take long for Zelda to make a significant dent in the feast before her. A new gluttony had been awakened within her, or perhaps it had always been there, waiting for the right time to come out. Food flew from the plate to the young lady's mouth as fast as humanly possible, the goddess barely stopping to chew as she took bite after bite, her stomach distending with each swallow. As space became available, more and more food was brought to her table, a different dish each time. Slowly meals gave way to desserts, all of which found their way to the ravenous woman's belly. By the time she had finished, Zelda had grown a gut filled to the brim with food, her red, stretched skin the size of a beach ball. She could hardly move as she leaned back in her seat, expression a mixture of pained discomfort and content pride.

"BUUUUUUUUUURRRRRAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAPP!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!" Zelda belched so loudly that the glasses and silverware on nearby tables shook. Although she drew some odd looks, none present dared to say a word to the girl who they considered a goddess. Zelda gently rubbed her taut stomach, groaning, imagining all the calories in her stomach digesting and becoming sweet, succulent adipose, and wondering how she would walk home.

The weeks flew past for Zelda, whose daily routine became increasingly simpler each week. By now, the seventh week since she had decided that the feeling of being fat was the best thing she had ever felt in her life, her routine was extremely simple. Wake up, head straight for the bazaar, eat everything set before her, waddle home, fall asleep, repeat.

For the first few weeks, the gluttonous goddess had received all sorts of weird looks and heard all manner of rumours about her. Some theorized that, as the personification of a Goddess, her gluttony bode well for Skyloft. How they arrived at that outlandish conclusion, she didn't know. At least the other main rumour, which was she was just really hungry, made a little sense.

But in the end, nobody ever guessed her actual motive, which was to make herself as big as she possibly could. A goal which, in her own opinion, was progressing well. As Zelda woke one morning, she paused in front of her mirror for a breather and an update on her body.

The thin girl she had once been was long gone, replaced by an extremely overweight one. Three flabby chins adorned her round mouth, with a fourth one beginning to develop. Two hefty breasts, each the size of a pumpkin, sat atop a massive gut that hung down to her thick, tree trunk sized thighs. And behind her were two heavy ass cheeks, each rivaling her breasts.

Smiling happily at her obese frame, Zelda slowly dressed herself. Her usual pink dress has been widened to fit her ever-expanding frame multiple times. As she pulled it down over her belly, she noted that it was beginning to feel a little tighter.

"Time to get this enlarged soon..." She muttered, pulling a pair of boots onto her flabby feet. "And speaking of getting enlargened... Time to eat!"

142112.content:
Zelda went through the rest of the day with a newfound resolve to diet and exercise before she gained any more weight. After all, what would Link say? Well, he wouldn't say anything, but that was beside the point. She knew that if she ever wanted her relationship with Link to go beyond what it was, then she would need to look flawless. At least, that's what she thought until she went to wake him up the next morning.

It was a long-time habit for Link to sleep in far later than Zelda considered acceptable. She went in regularly to wake him up, or at least send her Loftwing to do it. She didn't think that this morning would be any different, but as Zelda approached the sleeping boy's bed, he began to mumble in his sleep. "Zelda, you're so big... Mmmm... I love your belly..."

Zelda stood stark still in disbelief. Was this what Link really felt? The boy was always soft-spoken, though not completely silent, but this sleep-talk was basically a confession that he liked fat girls. She looked down at her own figure, and the small bump on her stomach. Had Link noticed it? Is this what had caused him to mumble that? Would she be willing to get bigger just for his attention?

She took a deep breath. Relax, she thought to herself it was just some sleep-talk. It may not mean anything. But maybe, just to be sure... Zelda turned to face Link's desk and the small brown journal on it. Link kept a journal. The blonde girl had no issues with entering Link's room, but had always kept reading his journal a boundary. It wouldn't be fair to him, after all. But did he like fat girls? If Zelda didn't know, how was that fair to her? She wanted him, so she wanted to make sure he wanted her.

Zelda broke. She opened the leather journal and flipped to the more recent entries. For such a quiet guy, Link sure could write up a storm. Every page was covered front and back in text, from diary entries to sketches, even a few poems. But Zelda found what she was looking for, an entry from last week:

"I don't know how to feel. I've always liked Zelda, but I just need someone big. I couldn't stand to fatten her up against her will, though. It's driving me crazy, especially since she's put on a little weight recently. Do I tell her? No. That's terrible, you never tell a girl they're fat. But if I like it, should I encourage it? Is that fair to her? I can't decide. Maybe I'll admit I'm into bigger girls. Even if she hates me for it, at least I'll have it off my chest..."

"Oh my..." Zelda whispered, almost forgetting that Link was asleep not five feet away. He did like fat girls. What was a girl to do?

143111.content:
Watching as Impa lead Link from the courtyard, Zelda clutched her chest. All of her hopes went with that boy she had literally just met. Nobody took her seriously, except for Impa, who knew of her prophetic powers, and the boy from the forest, who had a vision similar to hers.
"Please, be careful, Link," She said quietly before returning to her previous task. Eavesdropping on the King of Thives and the King of Hyrule.

As she peered through the window, she was disappointed to find that the meeting had concluded during her talk with Link.
"Ah, well," She sighed, turning away. "I suppose I should return to my room and wait for Impa".
As she started across the garden, the sky above her darkened. A menacing laugh echoed throughout the courtyard.
"My dear Princess Zelda. Didn't your father teach you that it's rude to spy?"
Zelda let out a gasp. She had heard this voice! It was the one from her dream that personified darkness and evil.
"It seems you'll be more trouble than I originally thought..."

In front of her, a dark cloud of smoke appeared. It was similar to the one her attendant used, only Impa didn't step out. Instead, a burly guy with tan skin and red hair did. He grinned at the young Princess, who stepped back.
"Ganondorf," She said, trying to remain calm.
"Princess Zelda". Ganondorf bowed mockingly. "I'm pleased you know me. But alas, forgive me for ignoring pleasantries as you have. I cannot abide a spy, you see. And the Gerudo punishment for a spy is rather... harsh..."
He laughed, reaching into a pouch on his belt. Zelda turned, intending to run for the window. Her father couldn't have left the throne room...

A hand grabbed her rough by the scruff of her dress. She let out a strangled yelp as she was effortlessly lifted into the air. Ganondorf held a small fruit in his hand, one that he shoved into Zelda's mouth. He forced her to chew the bitter fruit, dropping her when she swallowed...
